timeline.message: check operator image name after upgrade

timeline.bodyText: what happens when the test fails after this stage? The subsequent tests fails without a CRD?
timeline.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: The next step in the test is to install Operator which creates CRD. If the test fails after deleting the CRD and before installing the operator, for the next upgrade test the CRD will be created when the operator is installed. subsequent tests will not fail.
replies.author: vanajamukkara

replies.bodyText: My concern is if any of the upgrade test(may be the last upgradetest) fails and leaves the env with a missing CRD it is going to affect the other tests in other IT classes right?
replies.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: The idea is upgrade tests should delete the CRD(as it uses old operator releases) after the testing is done(success or failed). All the IT classes install the operator first, this is when CRD is created hence there won't be a situation where the tests will be run without CRD.
replies.author: vanajamukkara

timeline.bodyText: If the tests fails here the CRD version will not be latest?
timeline.author: sankarpn

replies.bodyText: If the test fails, CRD is deleted in the afterEach method.
replies.author: vanajamukkara

timeline.bodyText: Should we move LATEST_API_VERSION to test constants and make it configurable with env var?
